p: Quantitative descriptive analysis of the EVOO samples was performed by a panel of ten trained assessors included in the “expert panel” of the Department of Agriculture, Food and Environment (DAFE) of University of Pisa, according to the internal procedure for assessor selection and training ( Venturi et al., 2016). Sensorial characterization followed the method described in the EEC/2568/91 Regulation ( EEC, 1991). In order to better describe the organoleptic evolution of the stored oil, during the whole observation period the Panel was provided with a technical sheet specifically developed for this purpose. By utilizing the proposed sheet, it was possible to obtain a sensory profile of the stored oil as a function of the storage conditions on the basis of the first order descriptors of color, flavoring and taste and of the hedonic parameter related to the overall pleasantness.
